The card input widget can be included in any layout file using the following piece of XML:
To access the card reader in your application code you need to import the class
then find the card widget in the layout as usual
and then you can ask the widget for a card object. If the data is either incomplete or not valid, this will return null.
Card cardToSave = widget.getCard(); if (cardToSave == null) { mErrorDialogHandler.showError(\"Invalid Card Data\"); }
This card object holds sensitive payment information which will be exchanged for a token through Stripe\'s server. First you need to make some imports.
And then you convert the Card data into a token. NOTE: Do not store the token locally, but send it to your servers for processing instead.

Stripe stripe = new Stripe( mContext, \"pk_test_6pRNASCoBOKtIshFeQd4XMUh\" ); stripe.createToken( card, new TokenCallback() { public void onSuccess(Token token) { // Send token to your server } public void onError(Exception error) { // Show localized error message Toast.makeText( getContext(), error.getLocalizedString( getContext() ), Toast.LENGTH_LONG ).show(); } } )
